dao

Class BowlDao

  • java.lang.Object
    • dao.AbstractDao
      • dao.BowlDao
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDao

    public class BowlDao
extends AbstractDao
    Data Access Object to perform all data manipulation steps against the table BOWL of the underlying database system.

    The Data Access Object (DAO) pattern is now a widely accepted mechanism to abstract away the details of persistence in an application.
    The idea is that instead of having the domain logic communicate directly with the database, file system, web service, or whatever persistence mechanism your application uses, the domain logic speaks to a DAO layer instead. This DAO layer then communicates with the underlying persistence system or service.

    Author:
    mbsusr01

      • getBowlMaxIndex

        public BowlDto getBowlMaxIndex()
        Delivers the max index number of a persisted Bowl.

        SQL Statement:

        SELECT * FROM Bowl b WHERE b.index = SELECT max(x.index) FROM Bowl x;

        Returns:
        a BowlDto instance

      • getBowlMaxIndexAsInteger

      • getBowlMaxOrdinal

        public BowlDto getBowlMaxOrdinal()
        Delivers the max ordinal number of a persisted Bowl.

        SQL Statement:

        SELECT * FROM bowl b WHERE b.ordinal = SELECT max(x.ordinal) FROM bowl x;

        Returns:
        a persisted Bowl as a data transfer object

      • getBowlMaxOrdinalAsInteger
